medical_history.chief_complaint: Abdominal pain localized to the right lower quadrant (RLQ)
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began one day prior to presentation. The pain was localized to the RLQ and was non-migratory. There was mild nausea but no emesis. Patient last ate at 2:30 PM yesterday and has had regular daily bowel movements without issue.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of myocardial infarction (MI) status post coronary artery bypass grafting (CABG) and cardiac stent placement. Additional medical history includes coronary artery disease (CAD), hypertension, dyslipidemia, low-grade follicular lymphoma, gastroesophageal reflux disease (GERD), and history of upper gastrointestinal (UGI) bleeding.
medical_history.family_history: Mother and father died from heart attacks at unspecified ages; brother died from a stroke at unspecified age.
